description: Describes the connector that's identified by the ConnectorId.

parameters.name: ConnectorId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the connector.

nested_items.name: Connector
nested_items.description: The structure that contains the details of the connector.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the connector.

nested_items.name: ConnectorId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the connector.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL of the partner's AS2 or SFTP endpoint.

nested_items.name: As2Config
nested_items.description: A structure that contains the parameters for an AS2 connector object.

nested_items.name: LocalProfileId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the AS2 local profile.

nested_items.name: PartnerProfileId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the partner profile for the connector.

nested_items.name: MessageSubject
nested_items.description: Used as the Subject HTTP header attribute in AS2 messages that are being sent with the connector.

nested_items.name: Compression
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the AS2 file is compressed.

nested_items.name: EncryptionAlgorithm
nested_items.description: The algorithm that is used to encrypt the file.
Do not use the DES_EDE3_CBC algorithm unless you must support a legacy client that requires it, as it is a weak encryption algorithm.
You can only specify NONE if the URL for your connector uses HTTPS. Using HTTPS ensures that no traffic is sent in clear text.

nested_items.name: SigningAlgorithm
nested_items.description: The algorithm that is used to sign the AS2 messages sent with the connector.

nested_items.name: MdnSigningAlgorithm
nested_items.description: The signing algorithm for the MDN response.

nested_items.name: MdnResponse
nested_items.description: Used for outbound requests (from an Transfer Family connector to a partner AS2 server) to determine whether the partner response for transfers is synchronous or asynchronous. Specify either of the following values:
SYNC: The system expects a synchronous MDN response, confirming that the file was transferred successfully (or not).
NONE: Specifies that no MDN response is required.

nested_items.name: BasicAuthSecretId
nested_items.description: Provides Basic authentication support to the AS2 Connectors API. To use Basic authentication, you must provide the name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a secret in Secrets Manager.
You are storing these credentials in Secrets Manager, not passing them directly into this API.

If you are using the API, SDKs, or CloudFormation to configure your connector, then you must create the secret before you can enable Basic authentication. However, if you are using the Amazon Web Services management console, you can have the system create the secret for you.

nested_items.name: PreserveContentType
nested_items.description: Allows you to use the Amazon S3 Content-Type that is associated with objects in S3 instead of having the content type mapped based on the file extension. This parameter is enabled by default when you create an AS2 connector from the console, but disabled by default when you create an AS2 connector by calling the API directly.

nested_items.name: AccessRole
nested_items.description: Connectors are used to send files using either the AS2 or SFTP protocol. For the access role, provide the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management role to use.

nested_items.name: LoggingRole
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows a connector to turn on CloudWatch logging for Amazon S3 events. When set, you can view connector activity in your CloudWatch logs.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Key-value pairs that can be used to group and search for connectors.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The name assigned to the tag that you create.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Contains one or more values that you assigned to the key name you create.

nested_items.name: SftpConfig
nested_items.description: A structure that contains the parameters for an SFTP connector object.

nested_items.name: UserSecretId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the secret (in Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager) that contains the SFTP user's private key, password, or both. The identifier must be the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the secret.

nested_items.name: TrustedHostKeys
nested_items.description: The public portion of the host key, or keys, that are used to identify the external server to which you are connecting. You can use the ssh-keyscan command against the SFTP server to retrieve the necessary key.
For RSA keys, the <key type> string is ssh-rsa.
For ECDSA keys, the <key type> string is either ecdsa-sha2-nistp256, ecdsa-sha2-nistp384, or ecdsa-sha2-nistp521, depending on the size of the key you generated.

nested_items.name: MaxConcurrentConnections
nested_items.description: Specify the number of concurrent connections that your connector creates to the remote server. The default value is 5 (this is also the maximum value allowed).

nested_items.name: ServiceManagedEgressIpAddresses
nested_items.description: The list of egress IP addresses of this connector. These IP addresses are assigned automatically when you create the connector.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityPolicyName
nested_items.description: The text name of the security policy for the specified connector.
